intro: Patagonium microphyllum, commonly known as the Patagonian dwarf fern, is a unique plant native to the southern regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, delicate fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. This fern thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in shaded, rocky habitats. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help it anchor to the soil while absorbing nutrients. The plant plays a minor but important role in the local ecosystem, contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
